entry.title: The Coudenberg Palace: Once the grandest seat in Europe
entry.content:
The Coudenberg Palace: Once the grandest seat in Europe

The residence, known as the Coudenberg Palace, was the seat of counts, dukes, regents, kings and emperors. It was the pride of Brussels.

entry.title: Man stabbed in Schaerbeek on Monday evening
entry.content:
Man stabbed in Schaerbeek on Monday evening

The investigation is ongoing.

entry.title: Three young knife-attack suspects detained in Brussels
entry.content:
Three young knife-attack suspects detained in Brussels

Three minors suspected of committing a knife attack in a Brussels train are placed in a juvenile detention centre.

entry.title: Brussels rubbish collection: Route changes to optimise organic waste management
entry.content:
Brussels rubbish collection: Route changes to optimise organic waste management

The changes aim to reduce the mileage of collection vehicles as quantities of organic waste are surging – from 10,000 tonnes in 2022 to over 18,000 tonnes in 2023.

Monday, 15 July 2024

entry.title: Witnesses wanted for football hooligan vandalisation of central Brussels café
entry.content:
Witnesses wanted for football hooligan vandalisation of central Brussels café

Brussels police are appealing to the public for information over an incident in August 2022 when a group of Anderlecht fans trashed a well-known Art Deco café.

Wednesday, 3 July 2024

entry.title: Is Brussels the capital of solitude or where people escape loneliness?
entry.content:
Is Brussels the capital of solitude or where people escape loneliness?

Migrants are more prone to feelings of isolation. But with such a high density of expats, could Brussels also be the place where people escape from solitude?

entry.title: Brussels-Midi shooting: No arrests yet, victims of attack believed to be collateral

entry.content:

entry.content:

entry.title: Bertin Mampaka (MR) to preside over opening session of Brussels Parliament
entry.content:

As the oldest among those elected, Mampaka will chair the inaugural session of the Brussels Parliament later this month.

entry.content:
One person injured in shooting near drug 'hotspot' Peterbos

One person was wounded in the shooting in the infamous Peterbos neighbourhood, one of the 15 "drug hotspots" in Brussels.

entry.title: Some 4,500 people marched against far-right in Brussels
entry.content:

Organisers of the demonstration, which saw thousands take to Brussels' streets, expressed concern about the "alarming" normalisation of far-right discourse.

entry.content:

entry.content:

entry.title: Safe Brussels recruits influencers for anti-drug campaign
entry.content:
Safe Brussels recruits influencers for anti-drug campaign
